description: A group of inflammatory conditions of the gastrointestinal tract, primarily affecting the colon and small intestine.
A class of medications that inhibit tumor necrosis factor-alpha, used in the treatment of autoimmune diseases including IBD.
A genus of bacteria that is beneficial to gut health and is often associated with higher expression of metabolism-related genes.
A genus of bacteria that is associated with increased metallothionein signaling in the gut.
A genus of bacteria associated with immunoregulatory genes in non-stenotic tissue of IBD patients.
A family of bacteria linked to fatty acid metabolism genes in patients using TNF-α-antagonists.
A signaling pathway involving metallothionein proteins that may play a role in intestinal health and disease.
A metabolic pathway involving the breakdown and synthesis of fatty acids, significant in the context of IBD and treatment.
